content.question:
​A saltwater fish has specialized cells that contain  \(Na^+/K^+\)ATPase to help with osmoregulation. Scientists studying this fish investigated the effect of the different concentrations of salt in the saltwater on the activity of  \(Na^+/K^+\)ATPase between six and 96 hours (Figure 1).​

​Figure 1. Activity of \(Na^+/K^+\)ATPase at different saltwater concentrations over time. Error bars represent \(\pm SE_{\overline{x}}\)​

Which of the following statements accurately supports the data shown in Figure 1?

choices.label: \(Na^+/K^+\)ATPase activity increases steadily as saltwater concentration and time increase.
\(Na^+/K^+\)ATPase activity increases steadily as saltwater concentration decreases and time increases.
\(Na^+/K^+\)ATPase activity stays approximately the same throughout the experiment and at all saltwater concentrations.
\(Na^+/K^+\)ATPase activity increases only after 24 hours at the lowest saltwater concentration.

content.answer: \(Na^+/K^+\)ATPase activity increases only after 24 hours at the lowest saltwater concentration.

skill.text: 6.B: Support a claim with evidence from biological principles, concepts, processes, and data.
